conclusion: Rod length is 3L, two balls A and B with mass m are fixed at the ends, point O is the rotation point located at distance L from ball A, distance from O to B is 2L, ball A exerts no force on the rod at the highest point.
When ball A is at the highest point, the normal force from the rod on ball A is zero because the centripetal force cancels the gravitational force.
The centripetal force on ball A is mω²L and the gravitational force on ball A is mg.
Since the forces must be equal when A exerts no force on the rod, mω²L = mg, leading to ω² = g/L.
Ball B is at the lowest point when A is at the highest point.
Ball B experiences a gravitational force downward mg and a centripetal force inward mω²(2L).
The force exerted by ball B on the rod is the difference between the centripetal and gravitational forces: F_B = mω²(2L) - mg.
Substituting ω² = g/L into the equation for F_B gives F_B = m(g/L)(2L) - mg = 2mg - mg = mg.
The force exerted by ball B on the rod is mg, directed upward.
